musicalLanguage.description: One of the greatest funk songs ever written. Originally played on a Hohner Clavinet, the iconic riff and syncopated groove defined a generation of keyboard-driven funk.
musicalLanguage.structure: Intro (riff) - Verse - Chorus - Verse - Chorus - Bridge - Verse - Chorus - Outro
keyMoments: The clavinet riff: one of the most recognizable keyboard riffs in music
Verse groove: tight 16th-note patterns over a driving bass
Chorus: the melody opens up with 'Superstition ain't the way'
styleTips: Play it percussively — short, stabby notes
The groove is everything — lock in with the rhythm
Ghost notes and muted keys add authenticity
